column1: Cacocum is a municipality and town in the Holguín Province of Cuba.

It is located south of the city of Holguín and east of the Frank País International Airport towards the city of Bayamo on the Carretera Central Highway. The area includes extremely flat ground stretching south to the municipality's boundaries with Granma Province. Its territory is bounded on the west by Las Tunas Province
column2: and on the east with the Báguanos municipality

column1: Carretera Central and the Central Railroad pass near the Cacocum townsite
column2: the most populated settlement of this municipality. Two local sugar mills
column3: called Antonio Maceo and Cristino Naranjo represent Cacocum's main economic activity.

column2: the municipality of Cacocum had a population of 42
